pr_title: Added converter layer for search. Removed the code transformation.

timeline.message: Added converter layer for search. Removed the code transformation.

timeline.bodyText:

No license statements?

+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.search.documents.implementation.converters;
+
+import com.azure.core.util.logging.ClientLogger;
+import com.azure.search.documents.models.AzureActiveDirectoryApplicationCredentials;
+
+/**
+ * A converter between
+ * {@link com.azure.search.documents.implementation.models.AzureActiveDirectoryApplicationCredentials} and
+ * {@link AzureActiveDirectoryApplicationCredentials}.
+ */
+public final class AzureActiveDirectoryApplicationCredentialsConverter {
+    private static final ClientLogger LOGGER =

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: I have strong concerns about how maintainable this will be if there is API changes in this area.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
For any swagger rename, add or delete field properties changes. The code won't compile. Then we need to make a change to the Converter layer.
It needs some work compared to previous approach if no change needs to apply.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: This has been resolved from offline discussion and will continue with this approach in the short term until the long term approach to support such transformations in autorest itself is available.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Given that CharFilter can't be final won't this blow up if a customer makes their own extension with additional metadata they want to maintain? I don't think it is likely but this change makes this a possible issue.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to use two different enums? This can be shared between the custom and implementation layer.

timeline.bodyText: Should we check Field.isAccessible before needing to call into privileged code?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
This is a tradeoff.
I don't know if we want to block customer to reflect on the return model if they turn on the SecurityManager. The code here is to avoid failure on reflection when customer has SecuirityManager on their machines.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Oh, I mean check if the field is already accessible before making the privileged call.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Agree with Alan - do this only when required instead of always doing this as this has performance implications.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.author: srnagar
srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Why is the exception message used to determine if it's a 404 error? You can check if the status code in the response is 404 instead. exception.getResponse().getStatusCode() == 404.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: You are right. I will check the status code.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.message: remove message check and check on status code.
